message.content:
cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.MM, cs.RO

The paper deals with object tracking in video streams, which is a common problem in computer vision. The proposed algorithm uses Bayesian modeling and feature fusion to achieve robustness against various challenges such as occlusion, confusing colors, and changes in scale. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). The paper also involves machine learning techniques such as Bayesian model averaging and particle filter methods, which suggest the sub-categories cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.LG (Machine Learning). The paper's focus on tracking an object in a video stream also relates to the sub-categories cs.MM (Multimedia) and cs.RO (Robotics).
